intro: Sciodaphyllum pulchellum, commonly known as the moonlight fern, is a rare and enigmatic plant species native to the misty highlands of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, pale green fronds that resemble the soft glow of moonlight, hence its common name. The plant thrives in cool, shaded environments with high humidity, often found in dense forest canopies. Its unique botanical features include a short, creeping rhizome and intricate, lace-like leaves that are highly sensitive to light. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Sciodaphyllum pulchellum is considered a conservation concern.
